title: Enabling a More Circular Future for Medtech Packaging - MD+DI
summary: The healthcare industry is moving toward sustainability, which includes making changes to medical device packaging. Plastic Ingenuity provides an example of a new material and design for medical device packaging that reduces weight, material usage, and costs while providing better protection for the product.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new material and design for medical device packaging that reduces weight, material usage, and costs while providing better protection for the product.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new material and design for medical device packaging that provides improved product protection and is robust enough for reuse at least four times.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes a new material for medical device packaging that is lighter, more protective, and more reusable than traditional materials.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a new process.

title: Do deposits decrease beverage sales? Study says no - Plastics Recycling Update
summary: A study of beverage sales trends over two decades found that deposit return systems (DRS) do not lead to decreased sales. The study also found that DRS significantly increase container recycling rates, making them the most effective means of obtaining more clean, high-quality materials for manufacturing new products.
green_innovation: TRUE, DRS significantly increase container recycling rates, making them the most effective means of obtaining more clean, high-quality materials for manufacturing new products.
business_innovation: TRUE, DRS can create savings in the form of reduced extended producer responsibility expenses in Europe and Canada and lower costs for municipalities and taxpayers.
green_product: FALSE, the article is about deposit return systems and not a specific product.
green_process: TRUE, DRS is a method or technique in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: ['322110 - Pulp, Paper, and Paperboard Mills', '322211 - Corrugated and Solid Fiber Box Manufacturing', '322212 - Folding Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '322213 - Setup Paperboard Box Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE, this article is not describing greenwashing.

title: Explore the 10 Leading Circular Economy Examples in 2024 - StartUs Insights
summary: The circular economy is a sustainable alternative to the traditional linear economy, which is based on the 'take, make, and dispose' model. It encompasses a broad spectrum of practices to extend product life cycles, maximize resource efficiency, and promote reuse, repair, and recycling. This article presents examples of the circular economy in action across different industries, including compostable materials, sustainable packages, zero-carbon food waste management, and more.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes multiple examples of green innovations, which are innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as decarbonisation, reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption, nature and wildlife conservation, or the protection of biological systems.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes multiple examples of business innovations, which are defined as a new or improved product or business process (or combination thereof) that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes and that has been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm.
green_product: TRUE. The article describes multiple examples of green products, which are products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes multiple examples of green processes, which are methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: ['326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing', '325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product Manufacturing', '562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services', '562119 - Other Solid Waste Collection']
greenwashing: FALSE. The article describes a real innovation in closed-loop plastic recycling that reduces waste and the demand for virgin materials.

title: Finat reveals whitepaper on self-adhesive labels - Labels and Labeling
summary: This article discusses the role of self-adhesive labels in PET recycling. It highlights the importance of using self-adhesive labels that are designed to release from the PET container in the washing step of the recycling process, as this results in clean PET flakes that enable closed-loop recycling. The article encourages producers of packaged goods to critically assess the overall recyclability of their packaging designs and to partner with converters and manufacturers of self-adhesive labels to ensure that the optimal label is used for a specific purpose, taking the recycling into account.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a solution to increase the quantity and quality of recycled PET, thus enabling packaging circularity.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes wash-off self-adhesive labels as an existing solution to increase the quantity and quality of recycled PET.
green_product: TRUE. The article describes wash-off self-adhesive labels as a product that is designed to release from the PET container in the washing step of the recycling process, resulting in clean PET flakes that enable closed-loop recycling.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['325991 - Paperboard Container Manufacturing', '326199 - Other Container Manufacturing', '322291 - Paperboard Mills', '322299 - Other Converted Paper Product Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing.
